These three magazine parts (magazine spring, spacer, and follower) will allow you to load 9mm ammo into your 7.62X25 magazine without needing to push the ammo forward in the mag. I don't use the 9mm barrel anymore for my RomTok. I guess with a few thousand X25 rounds and how little I shoot it anyway, the 9mm barrel will never really be used. The mag parts just drop right into your existing mag. The barrel itself came from Numrich. It's a Norinco one. The machining is a little rough on it between the lug bands but it works just fine. There's also some small scratches on a couple other parts of it. You may or may not need a larger bushing for the barrel. Some people need one some people don't. It does include the link and link pin (not pictured). The bore is VG with no machining issues inside. $45. 

LOCATED IN OSHKOSH

title: For Sale:  MOSSBERG 12 GA. CHAIN SAW
postcontent:
NEW IN BOX


Certainly one of the most unusual-looking guns to come out is the Mossberg 500 Chainsaw. Built in the iconic Mossberg 500 action, the Chainsaw is a pistol-grip pump-action shotgun with no stock. While guns like this are desirable for home defense, they're notoriously hard to control while firing, a problem that Mossberg has solved by attaching a wrap-around chainsaw-style hand grip to the pump. Intended to be fired from the hip, this top handle allows the user to cycle the action while simultaneously maintaining leverage above the gun to help tame muzzle flip. In addition to the chainsaw-style grip, the 500 Chainsaw has a stand-off barrel that can be used to breech doors and three rails that can mount accessories.

Specifications 
Action  Pump 
Gauge  12 GA 
Barrel Length  18.5" 
Capacity  5 + 1 
Chamber  3" 
Length  31" 
Weight  6 lbs 
Drop   
Stock  Synthetic Pistol Grip 
Finish  Black

title: For Sale/Trade:  dr200  original import from Korea to Tuson AZ i also have a Kimber of Oregon imported one
postcontent:
for sale is 1 good condition Daewoo DR-200 rifle with 7 steel 30 rd magazines, or 3 steel mags and a 90 rd snail drum B-square mount and bushnell 3-12x40mm scope. Weapon also has buttstock spare mag holder. i also have a like new DR200 imported by Kimber of Oregon, has been cryo- dipped twice by kimber, this one has only had approximately 150 rounds. It comes with B-Square scope base Burris tatctical rings, and Bushnell 6x-18 scope. It is also in like new condition, Includes original box, manual, cleaning kit un-used
           The Daewoo Precision Industries DR200 is an assault rifle of the Republic of Korea Armed Forces (know as the K2), manufactured by Daewoo Precision Industries. It is a shoulder-fired, gas-operated,piston driven, semi automatic assault rifle that feeds from a 20 or 30 round AR magazine and is chambered for .223. The K2 replaced the M16A1 rifle in South Korean military use[3] in 1984.[4] The K2 formally entered South Korean military service in 1987. The operating system utilizes a piston driven upper that has a rotating locking bolt like the AR-15. I.E. it has an AK-47 like gas system and an AR type bolt giving it the best of both worlds.      my DR200 has a great gas piston system 223 rifle, works every time under the most extreme conditions, Daewoo DR-200 (semi-auto civilian version in .223 Remington), note the "post-1994 ban" thumb hole non-folding butt stock, required by American Federal laws at the time, but is no longer required as of 2004. 
   this is one of the best 223 platforms on the market bar none, if you have never owned one or shot one you are missing out for sure... they were doing gas piston rifles in the early 80's and made them dam fine i might add, it is like a FAL, an AK, and an m16, well all of the reliable parts, none of the bad things, you can only find these things from private party, or gun dealer who got one on a trade in, as they do not make them any more not for a while, but the part are all over the web ie daewoorifleparts.com  if you know ware to look... not that they ever break, as i said look for your self online in any forum out there, if the DR-200 is mentioned, it is being praised, for being a great all around battle 223 for civilians, very nice ask any knowledgeable gun dealer they can tell you too... You can also check out Stormwerkz for rails and stock adapters.   call me at REDACTED or REDACTED i may be willing to trade it for the right rifle/pistol/shotgun/cash or combination of the like, i have no complaints what so ever with either rifle, they are great just seeing what offer are out there, please email pics of trades to REDACTED thanks for looking...

title: For Sale/Trade:  ATTENTION; Survivalists & Preppers
postcontent:
Smoke & ILLumination devices;Mark 13 Model 0 Smoke/Flare Distress Signals
 These are signal, distress, hand combo flare and smoke. These are emergency signaling devices. On one side is orange smoke for daytime use. On the other side is an extremely bright flare for nightime use. These would be great for almost any outdoor activity including; camping, hunting, boating, RVing, traveling, etc.. Perfect for a bugout bag, lost prevention, or location notification in day or night. To activate either end requires pulling a ring, which breaks a seal, which in turn ignites the signaling device. 1 for $10 or 12 for $100+ free container. 12 signaling devices come in a airtight, watertight, military grade aluminum container. These are extremely rare and from what research I have done appear to be made for maritime, air, & special forces type personnel due to their compactability. Manufactured by Kilgore Co. I have personally tried about six of these and they work flawlessly despite being more than 20 yrs old. I Prefer NOT SHIP THESE, though I will consider it provided laws are abided by!!

title: For Sale:  Colt Model 1908 Hammerless .380 Pocket Pistol
postcontent: Colt Model 1908 Hammerless .380 Pocket Pistol, serial number 278XX (mfg in 1938 per ColtAutos.com), with one magazine, leather holster/accessories, and leather satchel case as shown in photos.  Semi-automatic; 7-shot magazine; 3-3/4 inch barrel; 7 inch overall length; fixed sights, grip safety; hard rubber stocks; blued finish.  I inherited this pistol from my father, but have never fired it.  It has been in my family as long as I can remember (50+ years), spending that time in its case on a shelf in my parents’ bedroom closet at their Northern California home.  My mother and I recall only one occasion when my father fired this pistol with a family friend who was a knowledgeable shooter and had acreage where this could be done safely.  I made no effort to clean or polish the gun prior to taking the photos and I have not field stripped or disassembled it at any time.  The slide and trigger action appear to operate smoothly and without evident excessive play or drag.  The finish overall appears to be in good shape with minor wear to the bluing in a few places (ridge of slide, lower front of slide near muzzle, left side of trigger guard where latch in holster engages weapon) and some slight surface scratches in a few places.  I did my best to capture these with the camera.  The rubber grips are sound but a bit loose.  I would tighten them but they appear to require a tool other than an ordinary screwdriver.  To the best of my (admittedly limited) knowledge, this is a highly original, lightly used Model 1908 .380 Hammerless Pocket Pistol.  $775/best offer in cash FTF sale with legally qualified WI resident.  Not interested in trades, thank you.

title: For Sale/Trade:  Nydar Shotgun Sight
postcontent:
This vintage Nydar Shotgun Sight is light activated. There is a large outer ring and inner dot that is projected onto the front reflective glass simply by being outside in the existing ambient light. Even on a heavy overcast day, this sight works perfectly!! This is the Model 47 and it is stamped "patent applied for". It was made by the Swain Nelson Company of Glenview, Illinois. 

Developed from technology used in WWII bomb-sights, it is a fore-runner of the red-dot, hologram and reflex-type weapon sights popular today.  Allied aircraft had similar sights using the exact same principal, and shot down many axis war planes using their modified Nydar Sights. The inner dot represents 12" inches at 50 yards, while the outer ring is positioned so that the ring itself is always 24" inches from the inner dot. This makes the Nydar Gun Sight the PERFECT "shotgun" hunting sight. 

There are adjustments for windage and elevation, the sight is mounted on a base plate and that is able to be manipulated for front to rear and side to side movement, once it is zero'd you lock it down. 

Cash offer or trade. 

Pick-up in Monument, CO or USPS Priority Mail shipping available for $6.00.  I accept cash, PayPal or USPS Money Order.

Please include name and telephone number with reply.

title: For Sale:  New Nighthawk ATS Falcon Commander Size 1911 in .45acp $2800
postcontent:
This Nighthawk ATS Falcon is a commander size 1911 and is the newest edition to there custom line of firearms, the Falcon has already set a sales record since its premier at the 2011 SHOT. It's easy to see why when you look at the sleek lines, as well as the practical features which make it a formidable fighting weapon.

One of the new features includes the introduction of our new one-piece fully machined mainspring / magwell combination cut from a 2 ½" block of tool steel. Rather than coming to a sharp point at the base of the grip, the integrated mainspring housing / magwell is rounded for comfort while not sacrificing any grip length. It assists in reducing print thru clothing while carrying concealed. You will not find a stronger part.

Sights are the new Heinie Ledge which allows the rear sight to be used to cycle the slide with one hand should need arise.

Three ball-radius cuts run the full length of the slide top to direct your eyes quickly to the front sight.

The rear cocking serrations are a series of eight ball radius cuts per side instead of our normal serration pattern. The rear of the slide is hand-serrated at 40lpi which matches the rear of the Heinie Ledge Sight. The barrel bushing is an extra thick variety which is chamfered around the edges. The front of the slide has been recessed where the front cocking serrations would normally be and the barrel crowned to complete the custom look.

Barrel choices include our proprietary gunsmith-fit Match-Grade Stainless Steel barrel or our new full-fit Match-Grade Carbon Steel barrels made for us by Kart.

Grips are golf-ball dimple pattern G10s in white with the Nighthawk logo.

title: For Sale:  Concealed Carry Weapons Training Course
postcontent:
Concealed Carry Weapons Training Course taught by Ohio Peace Officer Training Academy (OPOTA) Certified Instructors. Exceeds HB12 requirements. Certified Instructors have over 40 years of shooting experience & are current full-time law enforcement officers. We've taught this course since the law passed in 2004, that's longer than anyone we know of in Seneca County. This is the only shooting and moving course in the area. We’ve trained 100’ s of citizens including men, women, elderly, disabled & from almost every profession including doctors, teachers & lawyers. We teach experienced and novice shooters. You won't be shooting at a paper plate at 15 or 20 feet and get a certificate. We'll show you how to move to cover, room to room, shoot on the move, forward & backward & more. Classes are held at Tiffin PD.
Call REDACTED or stop by the Mountain Man Trading Post ,1741 S SR 53 ,Tiffin, Ohio Fee $75
Includes copy of State Handbook, Certificate & a wealth of information from men who carry a firearm almost everyday of the week for self defense and defense of others.

Next class is Saturday April 14, 8a-8p at Tiffin PD indoor range.

This class is limited on space, must confirm prior to arrival.

You need a pistol (or let me know in advance I have several), 100 or more rounds of ammo (22's are fine but bring your carry pistol and 25 rounds of ammo also). Strong side belt holster, eye & ear protection is mandatory. And be ready to shoot and spend several hours on the range. 

Thanks,

Craig

title: For Sale:  Very rare Albainian SKS
postcontent:
About 18,000 of these were manufactured at the Umgramsh Factory from 1967 through 1979.  It is believed that fewer than 6,000 survived destruction during the UN-led disarming initiative after the Balkan wars.  Albania itself was an isolated western bastion of Maoism, and thus at odds with its Soviet-influenced neighbors.  By 1961, relations were completely broken off with the USSR and other Warsaw Pact nations, leaving China as Albania's only ally.  By 1978, even China had cut off aid (perhaps explaining why manufacture of these rifles ceased?)  Albania's SKS rifle was distinctive.  The Albanian SKS has a longer handguard than most SKS's, an AK-style charging handle, a buttplate with two trapdoors instead of one, a Y shaped folding spike bayonet instead of the more traditional X shaped cruciform, a differently-contoured magazine other SKS's, and a sling swivel on the left side of the buttstock. 
 This SKS (Samozariadnyia Karabina Simonova, or Simonov Self-loading Carbine) was manufactured in 1970.  All numbers match, and the carbine is NOT import-marked.
 I have included a pic of it above a Yugoslavian SKS for comparison.

title: For Sale:  Chip McCormick 1911 match grade custom
location: West Downtown OKC, Oklahoma City, Oklahoma
postcontent:
Would you like to own a rare conversation piece that also happens to be a match grade custom?  I have for sale a Chip McCormick 1911.  I can't even find one of these for sale...anywhere.  Here's the story as I understand it.

This gun has sat in the safe of a good friend of mine for at least 12 years.  He took it in trade for some body work he did for a customer, and has never shot it. Now he wants to sell it.  I have spent 2 days researching this gun and have learned a lot about it.

In the 1990s, Chip McCormick offered matching frame and slide kits.  These were expensive match grade parts that gunsmiths could buy and assemble their own custom 1911.  They came with Kart barrels.  Because of the cost of these, most were built with high end parts.

This is a low serial number example of the Chip McCormick 1911.  This gun has a CM trigger set that feels like a million bucks.  The Kart barrel has a little pitting near the bushing, but that's just from being stored.  The bushing is very tight, and I suspect that this thing will be quite the little tack driver.  The backstrap has beautiful checkering that continues up the grip safety.  The finish is parkerized, with wear only visible in one spot on the slide.

Chip McCormick helped get Kimber off the ground, and if you look, this 1911 has several design cues that show this to be an ancestor to the Kimber.  

For those of you who appreciate simplicity, the only markings on this 1911 are the serial number, and "Chip McCormick Corp, Austin TX USA"

It also has some custom laser etched grips with very deep etching.  The grips are in perfect condition.  Take a look in the pictures.  The slide rails, feedramp and hammer show basically zero wear.  I don't think this has been fired much at all.

Make a cash offer.  No trades for this one.  Prefer FTF, but would ship to your FFL for $30.
